meanings.sent1: The movie contained objectionable scenes that made some viewers uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The smell from the garbage can was objectionable to everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The objectionable noise coming from the neighbor's party kept me up all night.
meanings.sent4: The politician's behavior was so objectionable, it tarnished his reputation irreparably.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the medicine was so objectionable that the child refused to take it.

meanings.definition: Giving reason for disapproval; deserving of objection.
meanings.sent1: The company's objectionable practices led to a public outcry for change.
meanings.sent2: His objectionable behavior at the meeting caused tension among the team members.
meanings.sent3: The objectionable decision to cancel the event disappointed many attendees.
meanings.sent4: The objectionable actions of the suspect left the detectives with no choice but to arrest him.
meanings.sent5: The objectionable smell coming from the kitchen indicated that something was burning.
